title: Making a keen mod
content:
Hi, im new here. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

i wanna know how to create a keen mod.
i searched everywhere but did not find the answer.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content:
Try googling Keen:modding; it will lead you to the #1 modding site, with info on tools to use and patches.

The biggest question is what game you want to mod, 1-3 or 4-6; the first is much easier than the latter. I'll see if I can write up a tutorial sometime.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

EDIT: i found a program called modkeen32. is this for keen 4-6?

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content: AFAIK, modkeen32 will only work on Keen 1-3. You'll need ModKeen2 to edit the graphics in Keen 4-6.

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content:
Yeah, modkeen32 is the old 1-3 modkeen compiled again in 32 bit instead of the old 16 bit (IIRC) because the old stopped working on some machines, such as mine.

Anyways, welcome. Cool that we're getting a lot new members lately. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Using the modding programs will be really easy, but the difficult part is that there's a lot to do (obviously), mainly the graphics. Good luck with that, Keen 4-6 is a lot work. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content: Well, there are a few things you need to make a mod - you need ModKeen (to put your edited graphics into the game), a level editor (like CKludge for Keen 1-3, or Keen: Next for Keen 4-6) and CKPatch (to add patches to the game). The amount of work needed to make a Keen 4-6 mod is massive, so you might want to start off making a Keen 1-3 mod.

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content:
Didn't I tell you to start with 1-3?

You've got your work cut out for you, and a lot of work it is!

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content: but is modkeen somthing like paint? but then only for keen?

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content:
No. Modkeen is just a small program that extracts all of the images from the game. From there, you can use Paint, Photoshop, or whatever, to edit all of the images.
Then you can use Modkeen to put the edited images back into the game, so that you can see them when you play it.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content:
To extract:

either make a BAT file, or access the command prompt, enter this command:

modkeen -episode=4 -export

To import use:

modkeen -episode=4 -import


Make sure your Keen executable has been UNLZEXE'd first.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content:
Yes, so you create a random file and rename it to file.bat...

Is it me, or do you seem to be lacking some basic computer skills? It's recommended that you learn a bit more about files and how to go around and do stuff before starting to mod. After all, people who grew up with graphical OSes probably never even used MS-DOS much, and it can look like hell for them. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

- Make a file. Doesn't matter what kind of file, but txt is recommended because those are easy to open in notepad.
- Enter MS-DOS commands in the file in notepad (NOT Word or Wordpad, because that adds extra garbage to the file you don't want).
- Rename the extension of the file to bat.
- If you want to edit the file further, right-click the bat and select 'edit' (or 'bewerken' in Dutch).____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Making a keen mod
content:
Either:

1.) Your KEEN4.EXE is not version 1.4 (Get and use the version 1.4 patch if this is so.)

or

2.) (More likely) you have not decompressed your KEEN4.EXE. The file should be 257 KB in size, if it is much smaller, get UNLZEXE and drag your KEEN4.EXE on top of it.

question: is there a program to change the enemies its speed and more of such things?

title: well...
content:
There's not exactly a program, but it is possible.

If you want to make any changes to the way the game works--Keen's jump height, the number of shots it takes to kill a Vorticon, the text for the menus, etc--you'll need to use the CKPatch utility.

Basically, instead of running Keen1.exe, you'll run MyMod.bat, which will change some of the code as it is loaded into memory--the same way the old Game Genie or GameShark devices work for game consoles.

It'll be a little more work, because there's no GUI to help you out--but for the most part, it'll just be a big text file full of things you cut and paste.

There's a comprehensive patch index [url=http://levellord.toxicsheep.com/Index/]here[/url]. Good luck!

title: Re: well...
content:
I'm no expert at animation, but what about trying this?

[img]http://davince.sitesled.com/images/bubble-perhaps.png[/img]

First, have a fully coloured bubble grow for a few frames. Then just have its outline there - its insides transparent. Then make it disappear entirely, and restart this animation after a short while of nothing.

I've seen people do it like this before, and it should work out pretty well. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: well...
content:
The biggest limitation of animation in a Keen:Vorticons mod is that you only get 4 frames, and they cycle rather quickly. Most bubbly goop needs to be slow, random, or otherwise in flux in order to look right.

Nothing a little creativity can't solve--but it does take some planning.
